title: [QUESTION] Compare contrast with JS libraries
body: Q: How does _Skia(Sharp)_ compare contrast with JS libraries like [_Babylon_](https://babylonjs.com) of [_THREE_](https://threejs.org)? Aside from the obvious, I get it, the `CSharp` interop aspects. Also, that the JS libraries are purely JS canvas oriented. But perhaps in a bit more depth, insightfulness. Thank you...

comments.author: artemiusgreat
comments.body:
My knowledge of Skia is limited, so take it with a grain of salt. 

Blazor bindings of SkiaSharp in Web work with HTML canvas element. 
This element provides two types of API - 2D Canvas and 3D Web GL. 
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLCanvasElement/getContext

```
const canvas = document.querySelector("canvas");
const c2d = canvas.getContext("2d");
const c3d = canvas.getContext("webgl");
```

The same APIs are already exposed in SkiaSharp - SKCanvasView and SKGLView. 
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/tree/main/source/SkiaSharp.Views.Blazor/SkiaSharp.Views.Blazor 

At the same time, Skia positions itself as a 2D framework, so 3D Web GL in Skia may not be as evolved as 2D Canvas. 
In other words

- For 2D rendering, Skia and JS should perform the same way 
- For 3D rendering, Skia may require slightly more coding compared to JS frameworks above

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
@artemiusgreat is correct. Skia is only really a 2D graphics engine. It can draw on WebGL for hardware acceleration, but still only 2D things.


For 3D, you will need to use another library. I am not sure of any offhand.

comments.author: mwpowellhtx
comments.body:
> For 3D, you will need to use another library. I am not sure of any offhand.

Well, that was partly my question, along the lines of, what is _Skia_ and/or _SkiaSharp_ bringing to the table, exactly. Sounds like they are completely different target markets, this, compared contrasted with a _THREE_ or a _BabylonJS_, for instance.
